news_header: Elon Musk's increasing political influence as he supports Donald Trump and engages in political activities raises concerns about the power of tech executives over democracy.
news_text: Elon Musk, the world's richest man and owner of major tech companies like Tesla, SpaceX, and X (formerly Twitter), has become a prominent political figure, endorsing Donald Trump for the upcoming US presidential election. Musk's political interventions highlight the growing power of private tech companies in global politics, as he uses his influence to shape debates and support conservative agendas. His significant financial contributions to Trump's campaign and public offers of cash incentives to voters demonstrate an unprecedented level of political engagement among business elites. Experts warn that Musk's control over critical digital infrastructure poses risks to democracy, as his unpredictable positions could have wide-reaching consequences.
